file_content.text: My research will be the greatest scientific advancement Alderaan has ever known.
Oh, yes! What a magnificent specimen! Yes. This one will do quite well.
I'm sure you'll find this to be adequate compensation. I have ample funds available now that I no longer have to pay my assistants.
Just take your credits and go. I have important work to do.
I can't continue my research until you bring me a live Killik specimen.
Why are you bothering me? Do you have any idea what I'm working on?
Wait. You're a Jedi. Maybe you can help me.
Wait. You look like a capable sort. Yes. I think you can help me.
Hopefully you'll fare better than my previous assistants... may they rest in peace.
What happened to them?
They were devoured by Killiks. A nasty way to go, though I suppose it's an unavoidable peril of this project.
I'm nobody's assistant!
Fine. What if I said we were partners? I'll even give you an acknowledgment when my papers are published.
What are you working on?
The details of my research are far too technical to get into. But the basic concept is simple: I want to domesticate the Killiks.
I believe we can learn to coexist with them. But I need a live specimen to continue the project. Something my previous assistants failed to deliver.
You sent them to their deaths!
I didn't want them to get eaten. I gave them all the necessary equipment to complete the job before I sent them out.
Aren't Killiks too dangerous to try and capture alive?
How do you catch a Killik?
The Killiks can't be tamed!
Every great scientific breakthrough must endure the scorn of ignorant convention. Wouldn't you rather be on the cutting edge of progress?
I've developed a neutralizer specific to one of the Killik hives. It temporarily turns a weakened Killik docile.
You can use it to subdue a weakened Killik and lead it back to me. I'll see you are well compensated.
You sent your assistants out into Killik territory and they were slaughtered! Doesn't that bother you at all?
Your assistants died for you!
An unfortunate but acceptable loss. The Killiks slay hundreds each month. Imagine how many lives will be saved once I finish my work!
I certainly hope so.
My research could be worth millions. I'll be sure you're amply rewarded if you bring me my specimen.
Take this neutralizer. Use it to subdue a weakened Killik, then lead the specimen back here.
You're insane! [Refuse quest]
Fine. Spit in the face of scientific advancement. But when my work is complete, you'll regret passing up this opportunity!
Quit bothering me! You're impeding the progress of science!
